meanings.definition: To give a title or name to something.
meanings.sent1: She intituled her new book 'The Adventure Begins'.
meanings.sent2: The librarian intituled the sections of the library for easy navigation.
meanings.sent3: The cat intituled itself 'King of the House' and demanded treats.
meanings.sent4: The sun intituling the sky with vibrant colors as it set.
meanings.sent5: The teacher intituling each student with a superhero name to boost confidence.

meanings.sent1: The judge intituled the painting as the winner of the art competition.
meanings.sent2: The certificate intitules the holder to a free meal at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The magic wand intituled the frog as a prince, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her smile intituling her as the friendliest person in the room.
meanings.sent5: The crown intituling the wearer as the ruler of the kingdom.

meanings.definition: To grant a right or privilege to someone.
meanings.sent1: The constitution intitules citizens the right to freedom of speech.
meanings.sent2: The scholarship intitules the student to a full tuition waiver.
meanings.sent3: The golden ticket intituling its holder to a tour of the chocolate factory.
meanings.sent4: The key intituling access to the hidden garden behind the mansion.
meanings.sent5: The special badge intituling its wearer VIP treatment at the event.
